title: Battleplan (military strategy documentary series)
description:
Battleplan (2006)

Battleplan is a military-based television documentary series examing the 
various military strategies used in modern warfare, since World War I. 
It is shown on the Military Channel and UKTV History.

Each episode looks at a particular military strategy (or "battleplan") used 
in warfare, through two well-know historical examples and compares them both 
with the military requirements needed in order to conduct that "Battleplan". 
All the episodes use examples from modern warfare, dating from the 
First World War (1914ÃƒÂ»18) up to the recent Iraq War (2003).

Episodes

1. Blitzkrieg; examples used: Nazi Germany Blitzkrieg Campaign, Battle of France, 
   Second World War and 2003 invasion of Iraq, Iraq War.

2. Assault From The Air; Battle of Crete, Unternehmen Merkur, Second World War and 
   Operation Junction City , Vietnam War.

3. Deception; examples used: Battle of Normandy, D-Day, Second World War and 
   First Gulf War and 2003 invasion of Iraq, Iraq War.

4. Assault From The Sea; examples used: Battle of Inchon, Korean War and 
   Battle of Iwo Jima, Pacific War, Second World War.

5. Counterstrike; examples used: Yom Kippur War and Battle of Moscow, Second World War.

6. Blockade; examples used: Second Battle of the Atlantic, Second World War and 
   US Submarine Campaign 1943-45, Pacific War, Second World War.

7. Siege; examples used: Siege of Leningrad, Second World War and Battle of Dien Bien Phu, 
   First Indochina War and Battle of Khe Sanh, Vietnam War.

8. Battlefleet; examples used: Battle of Midway, Pacific War, Second World War and 
   Battle of Leyte Gulf, Pacific War, Second World War.

9. Pre-Emptive Strike; examples used: Six Day War and attack on Pearl Harbor, 
   Pacific War, Second World War.

10. Control of The Air; examples used: Battle of Britain, Second World War and First Gulf War.
11. Defensive Battle; examples used: Hindenburg Line, Western Front, First World War and 
    Battle of Kursk, Second World War.

12. Guerilla Warfare; examples used: Mujahideen,Soviet war in Afghanistan and National Front 
    for the Liberation of South Vietnam, a.k.a. Vietcong, Vietnam War.

13. Urban Warfare; examples used: Tet Offensive, Vietnam War and Battle of Stalingrad.

14. Breaking a Fortified Line; examples used: Hindenburg Line,Western Front, First World War 
    and Second Battle of El Alamein, Second World War.

15. Raiding Operations; examples used: Unternehmen Eiche, recapture of Mussolini by 
    Otto Skorzeny, Second World War and Operation Ivory Coast, Son Tay, Vietnam War.

16. Strategic Bombing; examples used: the RAF/USAAF campaign against Nazi Germany from 
    1941-45, bombing of Dresden and the USAAF assault on Japan in 1944-45, Bombing of 
    Tokyo in World War II.

17. Flank Attack; examples used: Battle of Normandy, D-Day, Second World War and First Gulf War.

18. Special Operations; examples used: French Resistance, in the Second World War 
    and 2003 invasion of Iraq, Iraq War.
